name: Monk
description: A master of martial arts, harnessing the power of the body in pursuit of physical and spiritual perfection.
tool_proficiencies: Choose one type of artisan's tools or one musical instrument

features.name: Martial Arts
features.description:
Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons. You gain the following benefits:

• Bonus Unarmed Strike: When you take the Attack action and attack with an unarmed strike or a Monk weapon, you can make one unarmed strike as a Bonus Action.

• Martial Arts Die: You can roll 1d6 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike. This die changes as you gain Monk levels (1d6 at 1-3, 1d8 at 4-9, 1d10 at 10-16, 1d12 at 17-20).

• Dexterous Attacks: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and Monk weapons.

features.name: Unarmored Defense
features.description: While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a Shield, your base Armor Class equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Wisdom modifiers.

features.name: Focus Points
features.description:
Your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of focus. You have Focus Points equal to your Monk level (starting at level 2: 2 FP, level 3: 3 FP, level 4: 4 FP, etc.). You can spend Focus Points to fuel various focus features.

You regain all expended Focus Points when you finish a Short or Long Rest.

features.name: Flurry of Blows
features.description: Immediately after you take the Attack action, you can spend 1 Focus Point to make two unarmed strikes as a Bonus Action.

features.name: Patient Defense
features.description: You can spend 1 Focus Point to take both the Disengage and Dodge actions as a Bonus Action.

features.name: Step of the Wind
features.description: You can spend 1 Focus Point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a Bonus Action. When you do so, your jump distance doubles for that turn.

features.name: Unarmored Movement
features.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing armor or wielding a Shield. This bonus increases as you gain Monk levels (10 ft at level 2, 15 ft at 6, 20 ft at 10, 25 ft at 14, 30 ft at 18).

features.name: Uncanny Metabolism
features.description: When you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended Focus Points. When you do so, you also regain Hit Points equal to your Monk level plus your Martial Arts die. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Monastic Tradition
features.description: At 3rd level, you commit yourself to a monastic tradition. Your tradition grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.

features.name: Deflect Missiles
features.description: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. The damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.

features.name: Focus Point Improvement
features.description: Your Focus Points increase to match your Monk level.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Slow Fall
features.description: You can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level.

features.name: Ki Improvement
features.description: Your ki points increase.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Stunning Strike
features.description: Starting at 5th level, you can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent's body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike.

features.name: Martial Arts (d6)
features.description: Your Martial Arts die becomes a d6.

features.name: Ki Improvement

features.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
features.description: Starting at 6th level, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

features.name: Monastic Tradition Feature

features.name: Evasion
features.description: At 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

features.name: Stillness of Mind
features.description: Starting at 7th level, you can use your action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be charmed or frightened.

subclasses.name: Warrior of Mercy
subclasses.description: Monks of the Way of Mercy learn to manipulate the life force of others to bring aid to those in need. They are wandering physicians to the poor and hurt, but to those beyond their help, they bring a swift end as an act of mercy.

3.name: Hand of Healing
3.description: As an action, you can expend 1 Focus Point to touch a creature and restore Hit Points equal to your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier. This feature has no effect on Undead or Constructs.

3.name: Hand of Harm
3.description: When you hit a creature with an Unarmed Strike, you can expend 1 Focus Point to deal extra necrotic damage equal to your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

3.name: Implements of Mercy
3.description: You gain proficiency in the Medicine and Insight skills if you don't already have them, and you gain proficiency with the Herbalism Kit.

subclasses.name: Warrior of Shadow
subclasses.description: Monks of the Way of Shadow follow a tradition that values stealth and subterfuge. These monks might be called ninjas or shadowdancers, and they serve as spies and assassins. Sometimes the members of a monastery are family members, forming a clan sworn to secrecy about their arts and missions.

3.name: Shadow Arts
3.description:
You can use Focus Points to cast certain spells and gain supernatural abilities:

• Darkness: You can spend 1 Focus Point to cast the Darkness spell. You can see through the darkness you create with this feature, and you can move through it at 60 feet per round.

• Darkvision: You gain Darkvision with a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet.

• Minor Illusion: You learn the Minor Illusion cantrip and can cast it without components.

subclasses.name: Warrior of Elements
subclasses.description: Monks of the Way of the Four Elements learn to harness the power of the classical elements—air, earth, fire, and water. They can bend these elements to their will, using them to defend themselves and harm their foes.

3.name: Elemental Attunement
3.description:
You can spend 1 Focus Point to attune yourself to an element for 10 minutes. While attuned, you gain the following benefits:

• Reach: Your Unarmed Strike reach increases by 10 feet (from 5 feet to 15 feet).

• Elemental Strike: When you hit with an Unarmed Strike, you can choose to deal Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier) or be pushed 10 feet away from you.

• Elementalism: You can cast the Elementalism cantrip (using 1 Focus Point instead of a spell slot). Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Wisdom.

subclasses.name: Warrior of Open Hand
subclasses.description: Monks of the Way of the Open Hand are the ultimate masters of martial arts combat, whether armed or unarmed. They learn techniques to push and trip their opponents, manipulate focus to heal damage to their bodies, and practice advanced meditation that can protect them from harm.

3.name: Open Hand Technique
3.description:
When you hit a creature with an Unarmed Strike, you can impose one of the following effects on that target (no Focus Point required):

• Addle: The target can't take reactions until the end of your next turn.

• Push: The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier) or be pushed 15 feet away from you.

• Topple: The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier) or have the Prone condition.
